Package processingwrapper

Interface ProcessingApp

  • public interface ProcessingApp
    ProcessingApp is the interface implemented by client applications. start(java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Double, java.lang.Double, processingwrapper.ProcessingApp>, double, double) should be called to begin running a ProcessingApp.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void drawFrame​(Canvas mainCanvas)
      Once an app is started, this method is called once per frame.
      static void start​(java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double,ProcessingApp> appConstructor, double windowWidth, double windowHeight)
      Starts running the supplied ProcessingApp.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        static void start​(java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double,ProcessingApp> appConstructor,
                  double windowWidth,
                  double windowHeight)
        Starts running the supplied ProcessingApp. The most common usage pattern for this will be: start(MyApp::new, width, height), where MyApp is a class with a constructor that takes the width and height as parameters.
        Parameters:
        appConstructor - A constructor which creates a ProcessingApp given the width and height
        windowWidth - The window width
        windowHeight - The window height

      • drawFrame

        void drawFrame​(Canvas mainCanvas)
        Once an app is started, this method is called once per frame. The implementer of this method should write the logic to draw the appropriate entities on the canvas. The main canvas is to be modified by a series of calls to Canvas.draw(Drawable, Position) (or one of its overloadings). Note that the main canvas (and all of its subcanvases) will be cleared following the execution of this method, so the whole canvas should be reconstructed each time this method executes.
        Parameters:
        mainCanvas - The main canvas to draw on.
